alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:56PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF POTTAWATTAMIE...MILLS...PAGE... FREMONT...MONTGOMERY...SHELBY...HARRISON...OTOE...JOHNSON...AND NEMAHA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to around a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 554 PM CST, the back edge of a snow squall was along a line extending from 5 miles east of Persia to 3 miles northeast of Union to 4 miles east of Beatrice and moving east at 30 MPH. Areas ahead of this line can expect sharply reduced visibility for generally less than an hour. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Nebraska City, Red Oak, Clarinda, Harlan, Auburn, Tecumseh, Glenwood, Shenandoah, Oakland, Avoca, Villisca, Hamburg, Malvern, Sidney, Dunlap, Tabor, Treynor, Underwood, Peru, and Neola. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 17 and 48. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
